hook.text: After the diagnosis, everything changed. She lost her health but found clarity, compassion, and priorities she'd never had before.

buildup.text: Post-traumatic growth is positive psychological change after a struggle with highly challenging life circumstances.

discovery.text: Tedeschi and Calhoun found five growth areas: personal strength, new possibilities, deeper bonds, appreciation, and spirituality.

twist.text: Growth doesn't mean the trauma was good. It means you extracted something meaningful from something terrible. Both truths coexist.

climax.text: If you've endured hardship, ask: what did I learn? How did I grow? The pain was real. So is the person you became through it.

punchline.text: Suffering isn't good. But growth through it is real and lasting.

quiz.question: What is post-traumatic growth?
options: Positive psychological change that emerges after struggling with adversity
